name: Classic Pop Hits - Which Decade?II Online Trivia | Music | 10 Questions

questions.text: In which decade did Billy Joel take his "Uptown Girl" up the charts?
questions.explanation:
1980s.

	Billy Joel not only sang "Uptown Girl", he also wrote this 1983 hit. It got to #3 in the #US, #1 in the UK. "Uptown Girl" featured on the album "An Innocent Man". Billy wrote this song for his then wife supermodel Christine Brinkley.

questions.text:
The Rolling Stones have produced many classic track through the years.
When did they bemoan their lack of "Satisfaction"?
questions.explanation:
1960s.

	The Stones got this Mick Jagger / Keith Richard number to the top in the US and UK in 1965. "(I Can't Get No) Satisfaction" featured on the album "Out Of Our Heads". The line "Trying to make some girl" was bleeped of a performance of this song by the Stones on the "The Ed Sullivan Show" in 1966.

questions.text: In which era did Sinead O'Connor bring a tear to the eye with her rendition of "Nothing Compares to You"?
questions.explanation:
1990s.

	Controversial singer Sinead O'Conner topped the charts in both the US and UK with this track in 1990."Nothing Compares to You", which made #1 in 17 countries, was written by Prince.

questions.text: In which decade did Dawn "Tie a Yellow Ribbon Round the Old Oak Tree"?
questions.explanation:
1970s.

	Dawn, featuring lead vocalist Tony Orlando, took this jaunty track to the top in both the US and UK in 1973. "Tie a Yellow Ribbon Round the Old Oak Tree" was written by Larry Brown and Irwin Levine.

questions.text: Michael Jackson's hits span several decades, but when did he offer a choice of "Black or White"?
questions.explanation:
1990s.

	A chart topper on both side of the Atlantic, Michael Jackson released "Black or White" in 1991. This plea for racial tolerance, penned by Jackson, featured on the album "Dangerous".

questions.text: British band the Crazy World of Arthur Brown set the charts on "Fire" in which decade?
questions.explanation:
1960s.

	"Fire" burned up the charts 1968. It rose to #2 in the US, #1 in the UK.Lead singer Arthur Brown, born Arthur Wilson, performed this song wearing a specially designed flaming hat.

questions.text: Madonna has made her mark over the decades, but when did she ask the question "Who's that Girl"?
questions.explanation:
1980s.

	Madonna was born Madonna Louise Veronica Ciccone in 1958."Who's that Girl", which Madonna co-wrote, was a chart topper in both the US and UK in 1987.

questions.text: In which era did Blondie tell us that "The Tide is High"?
questions.explanation:
1980s.

	"The Tide is High" was a hit for Blondie in 1980. Lead singer Deborah Harry took this song to the top of the singles charts in both the US and UK.The bands other 1980s hits include "Atomic", "Call Me" and "Rapture".

questions.text: In which decade did the Four Seasons proclaim, "December 63 (Oh What a Night)"?
questions.explanation:
1970s.

	Frankie Valli and The Four Seasons hit the top spot with this track in the US and UK in 1976. "December 1963 (Oh What a Night)" featured on the band's "Who Loves You" album.The Four Seasons began life as the Varietones in 1955. Their first big hit was the US chart topper "Sherry" in 1962.

questions.text: Whitney Houston pledged "I Will Always Love You" in which decade?
questions.explanation:
1990s.

	This 1992 chart topping hit for Whitney Houston was written by Dolly Parton, who had recorded her own version of the song in 1974. Whitney's "I Will Always Love You" features on the soundtrack of the movie "The Bodyguard".
